title: Authors and Citation
text: Sarah Wright. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Wright S (2024). nccnclimate: Retrieve Summarize NCCN Climate Data. R package version 0.2.0, https://NPS-NCCN.github.io/nccn-climate/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {nccnclimate: Retrieve and Summarize NCCN Climate Data},   author = {Sarah Wright},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.2.0},   url = {https://NPS-NCCN.github.io/nccn-climate/}, }

what: Retrieve and Summarize NCCN Climate Data
title: Retrieve and Summarize NCCN Climate Data
text: goal nccnclimate provide tools R allow users easily retrieve NCCN climate data Aquarius export Excel.

title: Retrieve and Summarize NCCN Climate Data
text: can install development version nccnclimate GitHub repository :

title: Retrieve and Summarize NCCN Climate Data
text: ’s recommended (required) create RStudio project store data retrieval script data exports together one place. information set RStudio projects ’re useful, check introduction beginners.

title: Retrieve and Summarize NCCN Climate Data
text: time use nccnclimate package, need load use connectToAquarius function log Aquarius. must DOI network. sure put following code top script uses package. code worked last time ran now generating errors, likely aren’t DOI network, forgot load nccnclimate package, /forgot connect Aquarius. ’s also good practice put disconnectFromAquarius() end script.
code: library(nccnclimate) ## You must authenticate with Aquarius first connectToAquarius("aquarius read only username here", "aquarius read only password here")

title: Retrieve and Summarize NCCN Climate Data
text: run setup code, can use rest functions package. example export data Excel spreadsheets.
code: park <- "OLYM" wy <- 2022  exportNCCNDailySummaries(park_code = park, water_year = wy) exportNCCNMonthlySummaries(park_code = park, water_year = wy) exportNCCNDailyPeriodOfRecord(park_code = park) exportNCCNMonthlyPeriodOfRecord(park_code = park)

previous_headings: How to use > Export data to Excel
title: Retrieve and Summarize NCCN Climate Data
text: example , data export saved default file name R’s current working directory. ’re using RStudio project, just project folder don’t need anything else. simplest option. aren’t using RStudio project, can paste getwd() (“get working directory”) RStudio’s console window hit Enter see folder data exports saved default. use different folder, run setwd("C:/Users/yourusername//folder/"), replacing path quotes path folder want exports saved.

previous_headings: How to use > Export data to Excel
title: Retrieve and Summarize NCCN Climate Data
text: can also choose custom file name data export, like : Make sure include “.xlsx” file extension. can also use file_out option save custom named file different folder instead using setwd. Make sure folder actually exists, export functions create new folders .
code: exportNCCNDailySummaries(park_code = park, water_year = wy, file_out = "your_custom_filename.xlsx") exportNCCNDailySummaries(park_code = park, water_year = wy, file_out = "your/folder/path/your_custom_filename.xlsx")

previous_headings: How to use > Export data to Excel
title: Retrieve and Summarize NCCN Climate Data
text: default, export functions never overwrite existing file. want override default, change overwrite option TRUE:
code: exportNCCNDailySummaries(park_code = park, water_year = wy, overwrite = TRUE)

previous_headings: How to use > Export data to Excel
title: Retrieve and Summarize NCCN Climate Data
text: four export functions invisibly return data written Excel file. means run code examples , data won’t printed console. However, wish examine data R, can store variable (see ). export functions return list data frames R data frame corresponds tab Excel file.
code: park <- "OLYM" wy <- 2022  # Write the data to Excel, but also store it in a variable so it can be examined in R olym_2022 <- exportNCCNDailySummaries(park_code = park, water_year = wy)  # See the names of the data frames in the list names(olym_2022)  # Preview the top several rows of the average air temp data head(olym_2022$AirTemp_Average_F)  # Get a basic summary of the avg air temp data (useful for QC!) summary(olym_2022$AirTemp_Average_F)

what: Export daily period of record summaries for precip and air temp — exportNCCNDailyPeriodOfRecord
title: Export daily period of record summaries for precip and air temp — exportNCCNDailyPeriodOfRecord
text: Export daily period record summaries precip air temp

title: Export daily period of record summaries for precip and air temp — exportNCCNDailyPeriodOfRecord
code: exportNCCNDailyPeriodOfRecord(   park_code = c("MORA", "NOCA", "OLYM", "SAJH"),   file_out = paste(park_code, "daily_periodofrecord.xlsx", sep = "_"),   overwrite = FALSE )

title: Export daily period of record summaries for precip and air temp — exportNCCNDailyPeriodOfRecord
text: park_code Four-letter park code(s) file_out Path (including filename) .xlsx spreadsheet want create. Defaults file named park code water year current working directory. overwrite file_out already exists, want overwrite ? Defaults FALSE.

title: Export daily period of record summaries for precip and air temp — exportNCCNDailyPeriodOfRecord
text: Writes data file_out returns list containing data written.

title: Export daily period of record summaries for precip and air temp — exportNCCNDailyPeriodOfRecord

title: Export daily precip and air temp summaries — exportNCCNDailySummaries
code: exportNCCNDailySummaries(   park_code = c("MORA", "NOCA", "OLYM", "SAJH"),   water_year,   file_out = paste0("./", park_code, "_", water_year, "_daily.xlsx"),   overwrite = FALSE )

title: Export daily precip and air temp summaries — exportNCCNDailySummaries
text: park_code Four-letter park code(s) water_year Integer vector indicating water year(s) fetch data file_out Path (including filename) .xlsx spreadsheet want create. Defaults file named park code water year current working directory. overwrite file_out already exists, want overwrite ? Defaults FALSE.

what: Get all corrected climate time series data for a park — getParkClimateData
title: Get all corrected climate time series data for a park — getParkClimateData
text: Retrieves corrected, unsummarized time series data [PARK]_Climate folder Aquarius (e.g. OLYM_Climate).

title: Get all corrected climate time series data for a park — getParkClimateData
code: getParkClimateData(   park_code = c("MORA", "NOCA", "OLYM", "SAJH"),   parameter,   labels,   water_year,   include_derived = FALSE,   time_zone = "America/Los_Angeles" )

title: Get all corrected climate time series data for a park — getParkClimateData
text: park_code Four-letter park code(s) parameter character string indicating parameter retrieve (e.g. "Air Temp"). water_year Integer vector indicating water year(s) fetch data include_derived Include derived time series? time_zone String indicating time zone data collected . See full list TZ identifiers info.

title: Get all corrected climate time series data for a park — getParkClimateData
text: list corrected, unsummarized time series park

title: Summarize NCCN Climate Data — summarizeParkClimateData
text: Summarize NCCN Climate Data

title: Summarize NCCN Climate Data — summarizeParkClimateData
code: summarizeParkClimateData(   park_code = c("MORA", "NOCA", "OLYM", "SAJH"),   parameter,   label,   water_year,   summary = c("mean", "min", "max", "sum"),   summary_period = c("day", "month"),   period_of_record = FALSE,   time_zone = "America/Los_Angeles" )

title: Summarize NCCN Climate Data — summarizeParkClimateData
text: park_code Four-letter park code(s) parameter character string indicating parameter retrieve (e.g. "Air Temp"). water_year Integer vector indicating water year(s) fetch data summary Type summary perform. Options "mean", "min", "max", "sum". summary_period Period summarize. Options "day" "month". period_of_record Summarize whole period record? TRUE, summarizes across years dataset. FALSE, summaries grouped year. time_zone String indicating time zone data collected . See full list TZ identifiers info.

title: Summarize NCCN Climate Data — summarizeParkClimateData
text: data frame column data station

title: Summarize NCCN Climate Data — summarizeParkClimateData
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Summarize monthly total precip at OLYM over entire period of record olym_precip <- summarizeParkClimateData("OLYM", "Precip Increm", "Rainfall", summary = "sum", summary_period = "month", period_of_record = TRUE) olym_precip_2022 <- summarizeParkClimateData("OLYM", "Precip Increm", "Rainfall", 2022, summary = "sum", summary_period = "month", period_of_record = FALSE) } # }
